snippet: The Blue Jays won for the first time in five meetings with the Rays right-hander Jake Odorizzi, who entered the game 2-0 with a 2.00 E.R.A. against Toronto.
abstract: Baseball Roundup; Toronto Blue Jays beat Tampa Bay Rays, 6-2; other baseball news noted.
lead_paragraph: The Blue Jays won for the first time in five meetings with the Rays right-hander Jake Odorizzi, who entered the game 2-0 with a 2.00 E.R.A. against Toronto.

headline.print_headline: Blue Jays Overpower Rays, Getting the Better of a Pitcher Who Had Their Number
headline.main: Blue Jays Overpower Rays, Getting the Better of a Pitcher Who Had Their Number
